◆ widgetToClip()

void rev::Viewport::widgetToClip ( const Vector2 &  widgetSpace,
const MainRenderer &  renderer,
float &  outClipX,
float &  outClipY 
) const

Convert from widget (device) coordinates to homogeneous clip coordinates.

If given a z component (-1 to 1, mapped from depth buffer [0,1] via (2.0 * depth - 1.0)) with w = 1.0, the clip coordinates can then be converted to world coordinates by multiplying by the inverse projection/view matrix and performing a perspective divide

Parameters
[in]widgetSpace2D pixel coordinates within the render target, with (0, 0) in the upper-left corner, X = right, Y = down
Note
See: https://computergraphics.stackexchange.com/questions/1769/world-coordinates-normalised-device-coordinates-and-device-coordinates
